extendedInfo.description: Moxier Mail introduction in market.android.comMoxier Mail is the second to none EAS mail application that you can enjoy Mail, Calendar, Contacts and Tasks in Mobile circumstance with advanced and state-of-the-art features such as Category, Mailbox search, Local wipe, Data encryption, S/MIME and 57 languages in the world.Moxier Mail has been maintaining the perfect EAS Push mail application that Emtrace technologies made ever since 2008.Would you take Moxier Mail as the most latest and advanced EAS mail? You bet.Professional User InterfaceThe simpler, The better.Moxier Mail provides simple and professional User Interface to be able to improve your satisfaction and work efficiency on the go. Just dive to the pool of fantastic EAS mail with Moxier Mail connected with the Exchange server 2003 and 2007.Best Secure Mail environmentWith a variety of Security functions such as Client certificate, Local wipe data, S/MIME, Data encryption, SSL, Application Lock, Moxier Mail keeps your private data in the most secure way.Thus, you do not have to worry about your privacy and confidentiality of your data any more.Latest EAS protocol supportMoxier Mail supports Latest EAS IT policies in accordance with Exchange ActiveSyncÂ® and fulfill the Policy requirement by Many of Mobile operators in the world. (i.e. Max Email Body Truncation Size, Max Email HTML Body Truncation Size, Device Password Expiration, Require Storage Card Encryption, etc.)Effective WidgetMoxier Mailâs Widget enables you to find your Email, Calendar, and Tasks status on the home screen in a simply way. You can simply and effectively check new arrived Email, scheduled appointment, and your To-Do-List.Topnotch UsabilityMoxier Mail provides the professional user experience and advanced features that MS Outlook supports such as Local Search, Online Search, Category, HTML, Auto Discover, Out of office, Full screen display mode, Edit on original email once reply/forward, and Set message download size and more.Moxier Mail available in 57 languages worldwideEnglish(United States), Persian, Hebrew, Arabic, Catalan, Danish, Japanese, Norwegian BokmÃ¥l, German, Bulgarian, Thai, Finnish, Hindi, Vietnamese, Kazakh, Macedonian, Slovak, Ukrainian, Greek, Gallegan, Dutch, Polish, Slovenian, Tagalog, Bengali, Indonesian, Korean, Romanian, Albanian, French, Croatian, Serbian, Turkish, Bosnian, Czech, Spanish, Icelandic, Malay, Estonian, Italian, Lithuanian, Basque, Hungarian, Russian, Sundanese, Javanese, Latvian, Swedish, French (Canada), English (United Kingdom), Chinese (China), Chinese (Taiwan), Chinese (Hong Kong), Portuguese (Brazil), Spanish (United States), Portuguese (Portugal), Spanish (Mexico)

reviews.title: Works great!
reviews.comment: My company offers owa email access and no other app lets me get my mail with push notifications. Thanks devs!
reviews.author: Jim Webb

reviews.title: Notes
reviews.comment: Why eliminates original functionalities?  I need the notes back.  Also please allow to download full email download feature, do not limit it to 100K. I would like to have that ability and don\'t do it in two steps as currently is.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works, but updates?
reviews.comment: Works pretty good, but there\'s very little development. For example, where are detailed notifications for Jelly Bean? I\'d love to see that.
reviews.author: Robert Crockett

reviews.title: Doesnt work after being bought
reviews.comment: My emails do not come to my moxier mail anymore. I purchased license but nobody from moxier cares about my issue. Not recommended.
reviews.author: Mark Mayo

reviews.title: works, but cannot send mails thru\' Moxier
reviews.comment: My company offers owa email access and no other app lets me get my mail with push notifications.  but I can use the Moxier mail app as READ only....as not able to reply / forward / send mails from Moxier app on my Galaxy Note 2....  i also checked sending the mail to my personla gmail account, but neither it reflects in sent box of Moxier exchange mail nor it is in Inbox of Gmail.... i also tried sending to my other colleagues, but they too have not recd.  otherwise inbox sync & sent box sync of mails sent from my desktop is good.  if SENT option works on this app on my Handset , then it is full ON 5 star from me.   OR do i have to purchase the key to have this option functionaling.......developer..please reply ???
reviews.author: Anil Pardeshi

reviews.title: No Notes - Loses out to Nitro Desk Touchdown
reviews.comment: This is a very good Exchange mail system - but the version I installed a few days ago has (apparently) had the Notes functionality removed and I\'m one of those old-school Palm leftovers who has a huge pile of notes that I frequently use.  The competing product (Touchdown) seems as good with mail but retains Notes.  If there isn\'t movement on this by the time the trial expires (30 days), I\'ll probably not come back.  Are you listening to your customers, Emtrace????  It shouldn\'t necessary to buy Exchange/Notes compatibility in the first place
reviews.author: Scott Morris

reviews.title: Abandoned?
reviews.comment: Feature set  \"meh\" and no updates for 6 months.... Could well be a waste of money buying this
reviews.author: Michael George

reviews.title: Average
reviews.comment: I like most of the settings it has, however something i missed is the scrollable email widget, that is a must for me, would be great if you consider adding it
reviews.author: Carlos Barquero

reviews.title: OK But No Notes
reviews.comment: Continues to crash-- trying Touchdown.  Nice widgets No notes Crashes/hangs more than it should
reviews.author: Jeremy Porter

reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: I respect the passion for genuinely simple and natural design of this client. Although it\'s made for Android 2.3 and doesn\'t benefit ICS UI improvement, UI is still amazing. I\'m not sure whether I would even like it to be redesigned for ICS so good it is. There is an alternative client - Touchdown, but that one was made by idiots who don\'t have taste. It looks like my first homepage from 90\'s with the same amount of bugs and dumbass approach probably made by their grandmothers. If you want a good Android client don\'t look anywhere else, it\'s worth every penny.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Poor email rendering
reviews.comment: It connects correctly so if that is your major requirement then it works great! However the emails do not render correctly like my default mail client or like Gmail app which makes this just average and not a replacement for the default client.
reviews.author: Calvin Kwan

reviews.title: All manual
reviews.comment: If I want a program that I have to set up manually, I would create my own one, we need something easy to use and automatic setup with servers
reviews.author: Marcus Moraes

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: Downloaded the free trial, saw it worked and purchased key right away. Would love the option to set a night/weekend sync schedule since I don\'t need my phone to be checking for email during normal work hours.
reviews.author: Gopi Chindam

reviews.title: No one told me it was trial.
reviews.comment: This was my original comment below (with 5 stars)  \"Subject : the best! (Y)\" \"Words can\'t describe. And thanks for making it free. Bless you.\"  Until I was suddenly blocked and asked to purchase! Wow! That\'s a SCAM. I should have been told it was trial and will be on sale later. Uninstalling. SMH.
reviews.author: Chas Chas

reviews.title: Calendar alerts not always working
reviews.comment: I love this app except the calendar alerts don\'t always work and that is a serious problem for me. I\'ve emailed the developers but they aren\'t helping. Also, text for 15 minute interval appointments don\'t show on high resolution screens like my nexus phone and tablet. It\'s too bad because this is a great product otherwise.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.comment: Lighter weight compared to other popular Exchange clients. Good user interface. Supports multiple email types. Recommended.
reviews.author: Jason Hoekstra

reviews.title: Bring back Notes Sync!
reviews.comment: This was a great app until I updated and found out they removed the Exchange notes sync feature.  That was the main reason I bought it 2 years ago!  Their closest competitor, Touchdown, is way too cumbersome to use.  I really like the widget with the tabs for mail, calendar,  and tasks.  I\'ll say it again....BRING BACK NOTES SYNC!
reviews.author: Eric Scallin

reviews.title: Nice app, but lacks updates
reviews.comment: I used this app for quite a while, but finally it\'s extreme lack of updates as well as lack of some simple features finally drove me to try Touchdown instead. I won\'t be looking back.  Moxier developers need to get with the program. A $20 app should be kept up-to-date with current versions of Android. Moxier hasn\'t seen an update in over 6 months! Unacceptable. I would not recommend buying this app.
reviews.author: Kyle Maulden

reviews.title: I love this app
reviews.comment: A few months back my company instituted a new BYOD policy so I opted to turn in company BB and begin using my personal cell for work too. I don\'t want the company security policy installed and taking over my phone. Touchdown was clunky and I hated it. This app is sexy, clean, and let\'s me respond to email, meeting invites, have my exchange contacts, yet sec policy is only applied to the app. Couldn\'t be happier.
reviews.author: Julie Redmon

reviews.title: Battery
reviews.comment: Love this app, but have had problems with it completely draining my battery lately. Goes from fully charged to flat in a couple of hours. Hope to see a Jelly Bean optimized version very  soon!
reviews.author: Geir F\303\270rde
